inn1.comm: and he starts with a ball that pitches on leg and heads further that way, rightly called wide
much better line, and seaming away slightly, pushed defensively to mid off
straighter, Cook tucks the ball to mid on this time
that's leg side again, Cook gets across to push to leg but the ball takes the pad. Rahim takes it on the bounce with a slight fumble
tucks him up slightly there, but well played by Cook, he just opens the face and runs the ball down to third man
rocks back in watchful defence to his first ball
fuller, but wide of off stump and Kieswetter leaves confidently
that's a nasty blow! Pitched slightly short, Cook misreads the skiddy bounce as he shapes to tuck the ball off his hips to leg and is struck in the midriff
great comeback from Cook! That's much too short, no pace in this wicket and the ball is pulled away with disdain. Good, clean strike
fuller and on the pads, Cook pushes to leg in his characteristic way, but finds the fielder at square leg
yorker length, but way down leg and moving further away. Rahim dives to his right somewhat sluggishly but the ball passes him by and races to the boundary
much better line! Not much movement as the ball pitched on off, but Cook misread the line, playing inside it
Cook leans forward to push the ball into the covers
full and a touch wide outside off stump, Kieswetter thrusts his front foot out and leaves the ball with high hands
on a length, delivered from slightly wide of the crease and pushed across the left-hander, left alone
and there's more skiddy bounce from Rubel, Cook tries to tuck the ball to leg but is squared up and struck in the stomach once again
he's slipped a little too leg side there, put away easily to the fielder at deep square leg
was there an edge there? Big appeal from the bowler, but the fielders were slower to react. Kieswetter pushed forward tentatively and the ball whizzed past the edge to the keeper
full, yorker length almost and the ball comes off the outside half of the bat and rolls to the third man boundary. It was an edge, but all along the ground
back of length, Kieswetter gets in line on the back foot to defend
fullish and on the toes, Cook plays it away to midwicket, tucking the ball away under his eyes
left alone
fuller, pushed to mid off
shortish and quite wide, but Kieswetter leaves once again
so close! Big appeal for lbw! Pitching on leg and probably not turning enough, probably slipping down leg. May just have clipped leg stump, but you can't give those
backs away to give himself room, slashed into the covers
good length, Cook in two minds about whether to come forward or back, ends up pusing it awkwardly to mid off. Off the middle though
that beats the fielder at short fine leg, put away nicely. Pitched on leg and Cook clips the ball away easily. Just giving away runs there
not the greatest timing on that, but he's picked the gap with a drive through the covers
full and straight and delivered at a fair nip. Cook bunts it back at the bowler with a straight bat and mid off runs round to collect
too short and Cook rocks back to pull, but a fielder has been positioned at deep square leg for that exact shot
in the channel on off stump, Kieswetter pushes the ball firmly to extra cover
shortish and spinning back at Cook, who hops back and works it to mid on
spinning slowly and worked to midwicket
this pitch is dead slow, and difficult to get away, worked to leg
replay, Cook back and working it straight to midwicket
much fuller this time, Cook tries to sweep and misses
this time he connects with the sweep, not hard but enough for a single. Good over there from Abdur
good ball, probing around off stump, Cook hurries back and defends
change of angle, coming from round the wicket, landing it around off stump, Cook aims a flashing drive through the covers, and misses
shorter, and Cook loves that area, swivels back and pulls, without timing it perfectly down to the midwicket boundary
calmly paid by Kieswetter, who looks an edgy starter, working it towards midwicket
lovely shot, read the slower ball, and drove it correctly through the covers for a boundary
oh, Kieswetter will feel he's missed out there. Short and wide and asking for trouble, but mistimes straight to the point fielder
definite turn, slowly from around off stump into Cook's legs, he works it through square leg for one
top ball, ripping turn away from Kieswetter, who prods forward and misses by a distance
shorter, spinning quite wide, Kieswetter aims a cut but doesn't time it
shorter again, Kieswetter hops back, tries to force it through the off side  but doesn't time it
good bowling, good pressure building, Kieswetter trying to force it away but can't
excellent over from the revives Abdur, Kieswetter looks quite stuck against the spinner, he would never have faced conditions quite like these
full, Cook works it tidily away down to fine leg for one
aims a stylish drive, times it well but straight to the cover fielder
good ball this, Kieswetter firmly defends it
oh close! Kieswetter trying to give himself room and squeeze a cut shot away, but misses entirely
edging down the wicket, looking to stamp his mark, but Shakib is too wily and Kieswetter can't get it away
four this time, that will relieve the pressure, short, Kieswetter cuts, slightly from the toe end, but it goes down to third man for a boundary
Cook tries to manufacture a big shot, getting down on one knee and hoiking to midwicket, some muddled fielding saves four
shorter and Cook tries to force it through the off side but can't time it
top shot! Swept hard down to the square leg boundary in a flash, really timed it well
on the sweep again, doesn't get as much of this one, goes down to fine leg for one
excellent shot, that will give him some confidence, just leant back and timed it through point for four
defending from the back foot
fired from wide of the crease, Cook swishes and misses
was there an edge there? Cook tries to force the ball away off the back foot, there was a sound as it went through but Rahim fumbled it!
just a touch too short and slapped through the covers. Good fielding saves the boundary
driven into the covers, but straight at the fielder
nicely played! He just hung back in his crease, waited for the ball, and ran it off the face wide of slip
this one comes in with the arm, but Kieswetter is equal to it, and thrusts forward in solid defence
delivered from round the wicket, but spears this one in wide down leg. As yet no turn
leg side again, but fuller, and Cook gets down to sweep the ball behind square
not entirely in control of that, Kieswetter pushes forward and defends, ball takes the inside edge to short fine leg
that's turned! Cook tries to sweep but is beaten in the flight, and the ball rips away from him too
Big turn there, Cook goes for the slog sweep this time but can't connect as the ball turns sharply away from him
coming in with the arm, Cook backs away and chops the ball to point
staying back in his crease again, slapping the ball hard into the ground and easily stopped by short extra cover
a touch short, Kieswetter tries to whip the ball through midwicket but can't time it
gives himself some room, not really short enough to cut but he used the width to cut the ball out to deep point
round the wicket to the left hander. Cook taps the ball back to the bowler
edged and Rahim clings on this time! That one went on straight with the arm, Cook tried to cut but got a thin edge and Rahim made no mistake
cautious defence first ball
fuller and on his toes, Pietersen tucks the ball to midwicket
good ball to start, pitching on leg and turning across him a touch, but negotiated easily
pitching outside off and left alone
Pietersen steps back and away to slap this to cover
on the back foot again, and he pushes this back at the bowler
ooh, some turn there! The ball pitches outside leg from around the wicket and rips across the batsman, who is squared up in defence
that's much too short, slashed away behind point and all the way to the boundary
good ball, nice and straight and Pietersen hangs back to defend
fuller this time and he stretches forward to defend
has a drive at this one, got to the pitch of it and forced it out past cover
solid forward defence from Kieswetter
a hint of turn on that one, Kieswetter pushes forward to defend and plays for the extra turn, playing the ball away fine off the face down to third man
clipped to midwicket, but straight to the fielder
tidy start, flighted around off stump, driven down to long on for a couple
stretching forward and defending
nicely bowled, slow and looping at off stump, Pietersen gets a big stride in and defends
this one is slightly fuller and clipped down to mid on
just short enough to allow Kieswetter to get back and work this through square leg for one
oh, Pietersen's heart would have been in his mouth for a second there. He swept a full ball high and hard and it just cleared the deep square leg fielder. Good shot in the end
touch to short from Shakib, Kieswetter cuts hard down to the point sweeper on the boundary
good ball, spinning away from leg stump, Pietersen defends
Shakib continues slinging them on a good length, Pietersen can't get them away
on off stump, Pietersen defends
Pietersen is stretching forward again, defends and the ball squirts down to fine leg, some swift running brings a single
Kieswetter comes forward and defends, not trying anything too ambitious at this stage
nicely bowled, finding some spin off the wicket, Pietersen back and defending untidily
thrown up a bit more and Pietersen is watchful
epitome of defence here, attempting nothing fancy, tapping it away on the off side
good ball this, fuller and almost yorked the tentative Pietersen
thrown a little bit too far down leg, Pietersen attempts a big sweep and gets a faint edge down towards fine leg
nothing Kieswetter can do here, blocking away
Pietersen takes a couple of steps down the wicket, but Shakib slings it in quicker, and Pietersen can only defend
action replay, top bowling and a good battle developing
more calmly played this time, pushing into the covers and setting off for a quick single
well played, pushed down to long on for one
Pietersen's troubles continue, pitches and spins sharply away from Pietersen's hanging defensive bat
forward and diligently defending, looks a bit of a struggle for Pietersen but he's giving nothing away
forward and defending calmly into the off side
a little bit more edgy here from Kieswetter defending
attempts a big sweep, probably a touch full, Kieswetter doesn't get much of it and it trickles into square leg
clipped down the ground for a single
pushed into space for a single
a touch shorter, and spinning wider, Pietersen gets back and cuts firmly to the deep point fielder
massive appeal straight away for Abdur, catching Pietersen on the front pad but it was missing
well bowled again, Pietersen trying to flick it away but misses
this time it's arrowed a little too far down leg
left alone, the ball spun sharply outside off
tries to work this away into the leg side but can't pierce the infield
clipped down the ground for a single, not much on offer here
Kieswetter tries to squeeze a cut shot away, it's very close to him and he can't time the shot
that will do nicely for Pietersen, arrowed slightly too close to leg stump, Pietersen sweeps firmly and finely for four
full and calmly nurdled down the ground for one
Kieswetter aims a sweep very early, and dabs it round the corner for one
on the sweep again, playing it well down to square leg and the strike rotates once more
well bowled, on and around off stump, Kieswetter blocks
pushed into space for a single to keep the strike
good work from Kieswetter, keeping things ticking over, pushed for one into the leg side
well bowled, the off stump line is what troubles Pietersen, and he's defending

gone this time! Pietersen isn't happy but the curse against leg arm spin continues. Pietersen got a massive stride in, but he was struck in front. Amazing how this left-arm spin attack has haunted him.
Collingwood starts with a tidy defence from a good ball
oh well bowled, flighted, and ripping away, Collingwood was back and the ball spat past his outside edge
Collingwood kept on zero, working it to midwicket
finds turn straight away, pinning Kieswetter back on the stumps
beaten! This one didn't turn and Kieswetter flashes a drive outside off stump
gets something on it this time, working down the ground for one
on off stump and gently pushed into the off side
slightly shorter, and nudged into the leg side for a swift single
blocked away, completes a tidy over
worked away for a run into the off side
Collingwood stretching right forward and defending
Collingwood forward and defending diligently
pushed into the cover region from a full ball
Kieswetter tries to guide this down to third man but it's far too close for the shot and he doesn't time it
fuller and a more sensible single, pushed out to mid off
flighted up at off, Kieswetter slashes, but straight to the cover fielder
down the track and trying to push it to mid off but can't beat the bowler
defending again, good pressure here from Naeem
couple of skips down the wicket, pushes past the bowler to collect one
Collingwood down the track, trying to give himself some room through the off side, but can only defend
oh lucky for Collingwood. He was looking for that chip shot to midwicket, but it turned and skewed off the inside half of the bat, in the air but safe
stylish looking drive, into the covers where a tumbling misfield allows one
nicely bowled, held back a fraction, Kieswetter is forward and defending
this time Kieswetter gives himself a fraction of room and drives down to long off
a touch shorter, Collingwood on the back foot and forcing firmly into the point region where a diving interception keeps it to one
well played, edging down the wicket and driving down the ground, good milking
nothing Collingwood can do here, flatter, quicker and prodded into the off side
far too short, Kieswetter back and flapping it through square leg for an easy single, England content to try and milk singles for a while
excellent fielding, Collingwood down the wicket and forcing this into the leg side, where some diving fielding at midwicket stops the single
not a great ball, dragged down very short, Collingwood pulls, but doesn't time it very well, some sharp running collects two down to long on
on the back foot again, cutting down to point for a couple
nothing on offer this time, edging down the track and defending
calmly worked into the point region for one
couple of skips down the wicket, but it's well bowled and defended
nicely bowled again, just changing the line nicely and holding this one outside off, Collingwood prods it into the off side
Collingwood has picked this spot all series, edging down the wicket and clipping the ball over midwicket for a boundary
good response, spinning sharply and Collingwood defends
massive appeal, Collingwood tries to sweep and misses and it strikes him in front. He was too afraid to look up at the umpire, who decided there was an inside edge
calmer this time, working it away for a single
tight bowling, on off stump, a touch short perhaps, Collingwood back and slapping it down the ground
well bowled again, Kieswetter blocks
Kieswetter edging down the wicket, looking for an inside-out drive, but can't get it away
neatly played, opening the face and dabbing it away for one
Collingwood skipping down the wicket and clipping firmly into the leg side, there is a diving stop at midwicket that prevents the single
clipped away for one
defended on the front foot
nurdled to leg, but can't find the gap
hangs back in his crease to chop that into the covers
that kept a little low and came on with the arm, Collingwood jabbed down on it just in time
down the wicket, got to the pitch of it and pushed back to the bowler
whipped square, but finds the fielder once again
starts a bit too straight, allowing him to work the ball away behind square on the leg side
a couple of steps down the pitch and he goes for his favoured chip shot to midwicket, can't quite time it though
pushed down to long on
and he manages to work this away to the right of the fielder at midwicket, sweeper collects
uses his feet to push firmly down to long off
more use of the feet, but he taps it straight to the fielder at mid on. Good, tight over, but good running still got them five
really tossed up, driven inside out but straight to extra cover. Fielder collects it on the bounce
pushed back to the bowler
great use of the feet he slashes the ball powerfully through the covers. Rapier-like drive there, and the fielder at long off couldn't cut it off. And that's his fifty!
steps away to cut a shortish ball hard out to the sweeper
down on one knee to sweep, it's hit in the air but there's no-one at short fine leg, and the fielder on the boundary collects
given some width outside off, forced with a bat more horizontal than vertical but off the front foot out to cover sweeper
straightish and turning down leg, worked to short fine leg
clipped square on the leg side this time, and the return throw hits the stumps and rebounds, allowing another run on the over throw
down the pitch and almost yorks himself as the ball is pushed full and wide, but he makes good contact and the fielder at cover did well to make a diving stop
down the wicket and hacked across the line out to deep square leg
fuller and aimed at his feet, Kieswetter moves across to clip the ball in the gap at midwicket
pushed down to long on
this ball comes in with the arm, Collingwood gets inside it but clips straight to square leg
that's spun a little to take the outside edge, but wouldn't have reached slip. Played with an angled bat and soft hands, with a modicum of control
he's pulled that down a bit too short, and Collingwood hangs back to force the ball out to wide long on
that's a touch too short again, the glance finds the deep midwicket fielder
paddle-swept to the right of short fine leg, and they scamper through
Shakib's been too short this over, this one is short and wide outside off, but on this slow pitch Collingwood can only force it behind point for a couple
that's a big hit! Waltzed down the wicket and got underneath the ball nicely, lofting it very high and way over long on
steps away and slaps to long off, tennis-style
that's turned in sharply, but too short and Collingwood pulls powerfully and in the air, but the fielder at midwicket collects the ball on the second bounce
chance for a run out! Kieswetter cut out to the covers and pushed for two, could have been very tight but the throw was wide of the keeper and safely in in the end
swished out to long on
stands back in his crease, waiting on the turn and jabbing the ball to long off. A lot of bottom hand in that shot
on the front foot, driven strait to point
unfurls the slog sweep, but mistimed out to deep midwicket
pushes forward in defence
quicker ball, jabs down on it to find short third man
steps back and away to give himself room and slap the ball out through the covers
attempting a little nurdle to leg, but the ball doesn't turn as much as he expected, striking the pad and dribbling away to the leg side
starts with a shortish ball wide of offstump, Kieswetter cuts hard out to the sweeper
fuller, but more width on this one, and it's driven out into the covers
charges down the pitch to meet the ball on the full, slapped out to the cover sweeper
tries to force off the back foot through the off side, but closed the face too early and the ball took the inside edge, bouncing over the stumps and to the left of the keeper
runs down the pitch again and aim a wild swipe over the off side, but doesn't connect
shovelled wide of long off, the Tamim sprints round and dives to save the boundary, to big cheers from his home crowd
huge appeal! Collingwood is struck on the back leg, and keeper and bowler go up in unison. Was there an inside edge on that?

well, he's gone now! Collingwood uses the feet and tries to loft the ball straight, but slices at it and gives the ball much more height than distance. Razzak runs in a few steps from long on to take a regulation chance, and that's the end of Collingwood's innings. He hadn't looked too fluent out there, and he struggled to time the ball as well as he has in recent times.
Kieswetter lunges forward to defend. It's vital he plays a long innings here, it really hasn't been easy for the batsmen to adjust to this slow pitch
forward in defence once again
pushed to the covers. Watchful from Kieswetter
driven back straight, the bowler makes a diving stop, getting enough of a hand on it to discourage the batsmen from risking a run
just back of a length on off stump, Morgan is content to rock back and drop the ball on the leg side
full, wide and and that is a classical cover drive! All timing on that, just leaned across and caressed it through the covers
better ball, he pulls the length back a touch and Morgan defends
that's too straight, and Morgan rolls his wrists over the ball to get it out to deep square leg
Kieswetter went to pull this through midwicket, but was through the shot too quickly and the ball took the toe, squirting out to long off instead
not too short but Morgan goes for a whippy pull, the ball strikes the top of the pad and the bowler has half an appeal, but that was going way over and possibly down leg
yorker length, whipped to midwicket
steps back to chop the ball behind square
down the pitch and driven very hard down to long off. Ball was at the fielder in a flash
Morgan steps across to glance to the left of short fine leg and they run a very quick single
comes forward then rocks back, eventually runs the ball down to short third man
down the wicket and pushed to long off
he starts well, slinging it in, Kieswetter skips down the wicket but can only mistime a drive down to long on
dropped!. That could be a big moment, Morgan swept hard to deep square but Shuvo, coming in dived and couldn't hold on
more pain for Shakib, Kieswetter down the wicket and smashing down the ground for a monstrous six
good running, follows the six with a dab into the off side for a quick single
can't get this one away, defending into the leg side
excellent shot, using the close-in off side field to his advantage, reverse-sweeping hard through third man for a boundary
arrowed well down the leg side, too far for the umpire's liking
England on the charge now, Kieswetter down the track giving himself room and crisply driving for four through the covers
the crowd stunned, Kieswetter waits on a shortish ball and cuts through third man for another boundary
runs keep coming, knocked away for a swift single
nothing available here, Morgan clips firmly to midwicket
runs keep coming, knocked away for a swift single
takes a fullish ball and works it round the corner for a single
another great shot this, we've all head about Kieswetter's power and now it's on full show, down the track and smacking past mid off for four
nothing available here, driving into the off side where mid off fields
mid off pushed to the long off boundary, Kieswetter finds him straight away, slapping this down the ground
slower ball, well bowled, Morgan can't do much with this, working it to midwicket
good ball again, Morgan guides this towards midwicket
the runs continue to gush, Morgan down on one knee, sweeping firmly past short fine leg for a boundary, the crowd have gone silent
Kieswetter is just two away from his hundred but won't find it here, cutting straight to the point fielder
quicker, flatter ball, Kieswetter forces it down the ground for one, there is a misfield at long on, the batsmen think about two but decide against it
well bowled, fired in at yorker length, Morgan swings it away for a single to deep midwicket
no hundred yet, full ball on leg stump, Kieswetter misses and it thuds away for a leg bye
top bowling from Shakib, not giving Morgan any room to get it away, blocked out to mid on
dropped another one goes down for Bangladesh. Really not helping themselves, Morgan was trying to haul it over mid on but skewed it off an inside edge to the fielder at mid on who couldn't hold on
there it is, fantastic innings from Kieswetter. He has stroked his way to a sterling and crucial hundred. After misfiring in his first two games, he'd played superbly today
well fielded on the long on boundary, Morgan driving down the ground, long on skipped round and picked up right on the boundary edge
lovely shot. Crisp, clean strike from a fullish ball, over mid on for six. Timed ideally
better ball this time, fuller and around off stump, Kieswetter slaps hard at it, and it goes out to long on for one
well, I thought he didn't time it at first, but Morgan just skips down the wicket a fraction and lifted this, supremely for six down the ground
looking for a similar shot, but doesn't time this one and it goes into the cover region
Morgan looking to slash this through point, but finds only fresh air as the ball skulks under his bat
well bowled, full outside off, and Morgan can't swipe this away anywhere, going to the mid off fielder for a single

gone this time, Kieswetter trying to cut, a little too full and too close to him and he gets a bottom-edge through on to his stumps. Ends a fantastic innings, and he's congratulated by the Bangladesh fielders, good to see
he's off straight away, bustling down the wicket and working to long on for one
this is good from Bangladesh, Morgan can't get much of this, forcing down to long on for one
Wright keeps the strike, opening the face and dabbing to third man for a swift single
good bowling, saw Wright coming down at him, fired it in and it's worked away for a single
wow, Morgan has timed this very well indeed, edging down the wicket and clipping back down the ground and it flies for four
repeating the shot, but this time with less power for a single to the long on fielder
good running, shortish and Wright leant back and cuts it through the covers where deep point fields
Wright looking for a massive shot, doesn't get much of it and it flies high in the air, steepling around the mid off area, but no one can get there to take the chance
good shot this, better timing than the last, driving through the extra-cover region off the back foot superbly to complete a devastating Powerplay for England
good ball, right up at yorker length, Morgan tries to get it away but can't time much from there, and it goes out to mid off
Wright tries to be very fancy with the paddle/scoop/starfish/just-hit-down-the-ground shot, comes off the pads for a leg bye
Morgan advances and it's thrown well wide of off stump. Too far for Morgan, too far for the umpire

Morgan finally departs, third time lucky for Bangladesh, slower ball outside off, Morgan tries to drive it through the off side but plays to early and Tamim holds on, just, to a simple chance at cover
Wright is on strike and smites this through the point region for a couple
plays this well, Wright's whole game is set up for this type of shot, short-arm swipe over midwicket for four from a length ball
Wright flowing here, another length ball and he clubs it, with his lightning hands, down to long on, where it just clears the fielder and boundary
that's lucky for Bresnan and Bangladesh really hurting now, Bresnan tries to swing a yorker away, gets an inside edge and flies past the keeper for four
heaved down the ground for one, not timed but it gets Wright on strike
Wright continues swishing merrily, giving himself room and swiping outside off, doesn't get much of it but it skews away for a couple
times this one much better, but smart fielding at cover prevents damage
Bresnan aims another big heave, it goes down quickly to long off for one

Wight finishes the innings in style, and he's popped in and played exactly the sort of innings he's picked for, smacking the final ball powerfully down the ground, well clear of mid off for a mighty six

inn2.comm: starts by firing one across the left-hander - full and wide - and Tamim had a full heave at it. Missed the ball by miles though
that's straighter and shorter, and Tamim forces the ball hard into the covers, but straight to the fielder

Gone! Shahzad strikes with his third ball in one-day cricket! Shahzad hurled the ball slightly wide again and Tamim slashed hard, the ball flew off the edge down to third man where Tim Bresnan took a good, low catch diving forward.
great ball, perfect length and the batsman defends awkwardly with feet rooted to the crease
fuller, and the ball takes the outside half of the bat as Ahmed tries to drive to mid off
good ball for the left-hander, angled across and moves away a touch off the seam too to beat the outside edge
that went like a leg break! Pitched on a length and seamed away, beating the edge of the bat by several inches
slips in a fuller ball, but it's pushed down leg. Ahmed beaten for pace somewhat, but the ball is sliding down leg and they run a leg bye
settles into his regular back-of-a-length mode, tapped to midwicket
nippy bouncer! Kayes goes to pull, but pulls his head away at the last moment as the ball rushes on to him
shortish again, but some room given outside the off stump. Kayes attempts to flay it over the top but can't connect
slashed uppishly through gully, third man fields and they run a single
hammered away with disdain! The ball was full, but Kayes just swung straight through the line, hitting the ball on the up but timing the pants off it to beat mid off
another drive, but a tumbling Pietersen at mid off cuts it off this time
fired in at the off stump, Kayes leans forward and gets behind the ball in solid defence
driving on the up, the ball flies off the edge through the vacant gully area and down to third man
pushed slightly wide of off, Ahmed leaves well alone. He's played responsibly to his first few balls, but you never know when the rush of blood is going to come with Aftab...
thuds into the pads as Ahmed tries to whip it away. A half-hearted appeal is quickly turned down
banged in on a length, the so-called 'heavy ball'. Kayes leans back to defend
and same again. Bresnan's really found his length early on in every spell this series
and now he slip's in the bouncer! Kayes thought about hooking, but ducked his head out of the way
back to his usual length, and Kayes can only defend
just a touch of width given, Kayes chops hard at the ball and it races quickly down just to third man's left
on the stumps, Ahmed pushes forward to defend with a straight bat
bouncer, but outside off and Kayes tries to uppercut it to third man. Doesn't quite get hold of it though, as the ball pops over gully
drifting onto his legs, and Ahmed leans across and rolls his wrists over the ball to send it down to fine leg
good length, not giving him much there. Kayes is content just to drop the ball into the covers
pitched on a length around middle and leg, and then just went away off the seam a touch. Kayes adjusted to the movement though, dabbing the ball away to point
little sashay down the wicket and drills the ball past a diving extra cover off the front foot. Strong shot that, it fairly raced away
pulls the length back a bit, Kayes defends watchfully

pitching on off, the ball nips in off the seam and thumps into the front pad. Bresnan has a huge appeal but the umpire turns him down, poker faced. It looked to be going way over the top, but Hawkeye says it would have clipped the top of middle
fuller, whipped straight to midwicket
he gives him the bumper, but Ahmed ducks under it quickly
another shortish ball, and Ahmed goes for a full-blooded lofted pull. He missed the ball though, and it rolled off the body behind square
hangs back in the crease to defend
pushing slightly forward this time, but defended once more
that looked like it kept just a little low. Ahmed pushed forward to drive limply to point
Ahmed took a step down the wicket then moved back as Shahzad dug in the bouncer. He went for the hook again but that went way over his head
pushed into the gap in the covers off the back foot

remarkable shot there! Flicked lazily off his pads, but the ball raced off the bat. Excellent attempt by Morgan on the boundary is in vain, as his boot is in contact with the rope while he pushes the ball back in
shortish, he hangs the bat out to guide it down to third man
at the pads, but Kayes can only push the ball to mid on
slower ball, looked like the cutter, and Kayes prodded it out to point
strong shot! Ahmed moved across his stumps to change angle and drove powerfully through mid on. Nice looking shot, and it raced to the boundary
length ball which Ahmed tries to work to leg, but the ball takes the edge into the body
bouncer and Ahmed goes for the hook, but once again it's bounced way over his head
on off stump, Ahmed gets across to defend
stray onto the hips and that's tucked away behind square on the leg side
attempted bouncer again, but the ball didn't get up as high as Kayes expected and he had to duck low to avoid it
another short ball and Kayes pulls this time, hammered away behind square and a couple of bounces to the boundary
what was he thinking there? Ahmed moves way across his stumps and tried a paddle flick over fine leg, but the ball took the toe end of the bat and rolled out into the covers
fires in a fast yorker, dug out
slower ball, that's a half volley and Ahmed stretches forward to loft it majestically over the covers
too straight this time, and Ahmed tucks the ball to leg
another bouncer. Shahzad and Bresnan seem to be targeting Kayes with the short stuff here.
nicely driven off the back foot, but the fielder makes good ground at cover to cut it off
slightly slower ball, just rolls his fingers across it, but Kayes pushes forward to defend
slightly short and Kayes pulls hard, but straight to square leg
another firm push off the back foot, but finds Liam Plunkett in the covers
on the off stump line once again, and Kayes repeats the back foot drive to point. Can't find the gap though

and he's gone this time! Bresnan pushed this one much wider and Kayes flashed a cut without any foot movement. The ball took a healthy outside edge, and although it died on the way to Prior he did well to dive forward and take the catch cleanly
Rahim moves back and across to defend
short of a length on off stump and fended out to point
similar ball, and clipped to point once again
quality shot! A classical cover drive there, almost no follow-through but he timed it superbly and placed the ball in the gap
shorter and pushed firmly off the back foot. A misfield gives them two

dropped chance! Shahzad hurled down a full toss which Ahmed patted back in the air. It was just wide of Shahzad and he went for it one-handed in his follow through. Tough chance, but that wasn't the best effort
and he follows up with a wide, spraying the ball down leg
on a length, off stump line, and it's guided behind point
dropped straight towards mid on and they set off. Very tight single there! But it brings up Bangladesh's fifty, and no harm done
tucking the batsmen up there, good ball
short and pulled away in the air, fine leg runs round to cut it off though
on the hips and tucked behind square for a single
really good slower ball, and the batsman's done well to adjust there. Bresnan appeals, I'm not sure for what though as the ball came straight off the bat into the ground
on a length, and he just drops it into the off side
he starts with a shortish ball just outside off, Rahim opens the face to guide the ball to third man
great innovation from Ahmed! He moves across to off and paddles the ball very effectively up and over fine leg. Good placement
runs the ball easily down to third man
good, tight ball. Hitting a length on off stump, with just a touch of wobble on the ball, and defended
hurled slightly leg side, and tucked just to midwicket's right
widish outside off, Ahmed hangs his bat out and the ball whizzes past the outside edge, thudding into Prior's gloves
nasty ball to start! Just back of a length on off stump, and that spat up towards Rahim's grill
fuller and on the pads, tucked away into space
straight again, and pushed towards the midwicket fielder and the batsmen set off for a tight single. Good running in the end, but could have been tight if there had been any hesitation
on off stump, he opens the face to run the ball down to third man
digs in the bouncer and Aftab has a wild heave to leg, but he's not in position for the shot and the ball flies past his nose on the way to the keeper
tries for the yorker but pushed down leg, clipping the pad and trickling away
just too straight, the batsman gets across to nudge the ball behind square leg. Rahim wanted two there, but rightfully sent back
cheeky! He goes for the paddle again - strangely as fine leg is right back on the fence
that's too short with the keeper standing up to the stumps. Rahim uppercuts wide of third man for a welcome boundary
similar ball, perhaps a touch fuller but Rahim works the ball away nicely behind point once again
and he over-compensates with the slower ball, slipping down leg to allow the single
that's kept very low! Aftab jammed down on the slow cutter just in time
finds generous bounce outside off stump, guided down to third man
well, it's not lightening quick, but it's straight and defended tidily
Plunkett isn't impressed as this is slashed by Aftab, firmly and effectively through point for four
well that might remind Plunkett of his earlier woes in international cricket, short wide and thrashed for four
much better, fuller, straighter and defended
good ball to finish, full and at off stump, Aftab defends off the front foot towards cover
genuine offspinner, not much flight though, full and bunted down to long on for one
not even trying to bowl cutters here, proper offbreak, turns a bit and is prodded into the leg side
Aftab shapes very early to sweep and helps this over his shoulder for a single down to fine leg
that's nicely played, dropped into the off side with soft hands and the batsmen cross for a sharp single
slightly quicker ball, clipped to midwicket

nicely bowled, on and around off stump Aftab hangs his bat outside off stump and is beaten, Prior, who's been very vocal in the field whips off the bails. Time for a drink, if you're off to work and want to keep up to date with what is happening, I suggest following our rather smashing Twitter wicket feed.
starts well, he always does, and it's dropped into the leg side
on the sweep, connects well, getting down to fine leg for a single
we have a reverse-sweep, which is becoming ever more conventional, connects well, good fielding prevents the run

well we have some amusement out there, the ball gets trapped in Aftab's pad flap, Prior is buzzing around him to claim a catch, they end up wrestling to the floor like a pair of puppies, how delightful
defended from the front foot
big sweep shot here, connects well, single down to fine leg
driven firmly, another offspinner from Collingwood, into the covers
tries to guide this down to third man but gets too much of it, and there is no run
good ball from Collingwood, no pace on the wicket so it's difficult to get him away if he holds a line and length, which he is doing well
goes back and forces it, via a deflection off Collingwood's hand, down to long on
attempting another sweep, doesn't get much of it but toe-ends it fine of fine leg for one
Mushfiqur  keeps the strike working this into space
good stuff from Swann, holding his line well and the batsmen can't squeeze any shots away
lovely shot from Mushfiqur, got back early and back-cut a quicker ball past third man for four, really good shot
good cricket, follows the boundary with a calculated sweep down to square leg for one
flighted around off stump and Aftab defends
oh, quicker ball and Aftab tries to work it away but can't

oh dear, what a senseless and sad end to an excellent Aftab innings. He glances this to square leg, straight to the fielder, but sets off for a run that Mushfiqur has no interest in. Aftab is half way down and it's a tame and easy run out to finish the innings
Collingwood trundles up and bowls another offspinner, worked into space for a single
glanced into the leg side, gently, no run available there
plays this well, angled into the pads from round the wicket, Shakib helps it on it's way for a single
touch shorter from Collingwood and Mushfiqur forces off the back foot, Collingwood gets a hand on it, deflects it past the stumps down to long on
worked off the back foot for one to bring up the hundred
full, offering to spin in to Mushfiqur a hint, worked to the midwicket fielder
well, that is quite a statement, dropping down on one knee and smashing it in front of square for a powerful boundary
repeats the sweep shot, gets it a touch finer and it goes quickly to the man on the boundary
nicely done from Mushfiqur, just prodded into the leg side with soft hands for a quick single
good ball and Shakib stretches forward and defends diligently
a touch shorter, Shakib is back and defending into the off side
unfurls another sweep, more of a hack than sweep, but plays it well out to the fielder on the deep midwicket boundary
lovely shot from Shakib, no hacking here, just stroking a cover drive nicely, and scandalously slow running means its only two
pushed down the ground, Collingwood dives in vein to save it, but it goes out to long off for another single
a touch too short, allows the tiny Mushfiqur to hop back and pull out to square leg for one
worked into the square-region from around leg stump neatly for a single
nicely bowled from Collingwood, bang on a line and length and no run there
neatly done, classic middle-over-milk-down-the-ground 50-over cricket
waits on it and dabbed away for a single
Shakib is sweeping again, and connects well, out to the fielder on the boundary, Shakib looking good here
Mushfiqur clipping this into the leg side, but straight to the fielder and no run there
nudged with soft hands between square leg and fine leg for a couple
didn't time it perfectly, but played it nicely through midwicket for a single
Shakib tries to lean this down to long on, but gets no power at all on the shot and Swann fields in his follow through
too short and a touch too wide, Mushfiqur is in decent form and hangs back and threads this through point for an easy single
some very good milking there from Shakib, nudged into the leg side and some very swift running turns one into two
this is middle-over cricket at its best, nudged/nurdled/prodded away for one in the leg side
gently patted down past Collingwood for a single
good from Shakib, and it's a bit too simple for them really, turned from off stump into the square-leg region for one
run available wherever you like it seems, pushed gently down the ground for another easy single
gently defended from the front foot
oh dear, what a shame. A good innings and a good partnership ends with a well-timed sweep shot that finds a tumbling Tim Bresnan running round from deep midwicket
stopped off the wicket a fraction, patted back to the bowler
worked away for a single, all the hard work needs to be done again for Bangladesh. As Matt Prior shouts "plenty of runs needed here boys"
delicate sweep shot attempted, doesn't connect and it trickles off the pads for one
close call but missing as Shakib is trapped on the back foot trying to work it to leg
dropped into the off side, sets off for a sharp single, could have been close with a direct hit
nicely timed by Shakib, pushed through the covers for an easy single
stopped in the wicket a little, tries to force it away on the off side, but can't time it
back of a length again, and defended back to the bowler
cripes, that is horrid delivery. Quicker ball shoved way down the leg side, too wide for Prior and the umpire
back on line again, pushed off the back foot down the ground for one
nicely done from Shakib, pokes it round the corner for one to fine leg
well flighted and lands perfectly around off stump, defended resolutely
a touch shorter, allows a cut shot that squirts away for a single
defended into the off side
well bowled by Swann, Shakib can do nothing but defend
a touch too short, crept off the wicket, Shakib bunts it down to long on for a single
flighted up around middle, Mahmudullah turns it gently into the leg side
Collingwood continues probing around middle stump with no pace on the ball at all, Shakib defends
slightly fuller, Shakib tries to drive it down the ground but Collingwood dives and intercepts
full again, this time the drive beats Collingwood and they collect a single
around off stump, Mahmudullah is struggling for timing a little, pushes this out to point
much shorter, plenty of time here for Mahmudullah to get back and push through extra cover for one
some turn here for Collingwood outside off stump, Shakib is slightly surprised, we all are to be frank, and he prods it towards point
and bowls from a single step it seems, tidily around off stump, Mahmudullah tries to cut, doesn't time it too well, but it trickles away for a single
quietly played by Shakib, watchfully rolling his wrists over it to drop it for one into the leg side
Mahmudullah is back, trying to force this through cover but can't pierce the infield
better ball, fuller, Mahmudullah is forward and defending

another silly mix-up, Mahmudullah turned it into the leg side called a single which wasn't there, Shakib sent him back but Mahmudullah took a long time to turn. It's a tight call, a question of whether the bails are fully off. The umpires decide not. Fair enough, really
shortish, and Mahmudullah  gets back and cuts firmly through the covers for runs
great ball from Collingwood! Mahmudullah plays inside it and is lucky not to get an edge on that
pushed away into the covers for one
calmly forced down the ground by Shakib
what's happened there? The ball seemed to grip and turn, spitting up to the shoulder of the bat then looping up off the the thigh pad to vacant square leg
pushes forward in defence
defended again, but with an angled bat this time, placing the ball between cover and point
tossed up, full and wide, and Mahmudullah nudges it away with an angled bat
tucked to the leg side, but too close to the fielder to risk a run
and again, full and straight and worked to leg, but can't find the gap
slightly shorter and, with very little turn on the ball, he pushes it down to long off
round the wicket, and he strays onto Shakib's pads. Good running fetches him two
flighted again, almost yorker length. Shakib drives hard to the right of the bowler, who dives but can't get down to the ball in time, and Shakib keeps the strike
deft touch! Shakib leans across to the off side, exposing the stumps and paddles a full ball very fine and down to the boundary. Well executed
and four more! Shakib is starting to roll here, he's swept that away powerfully to deep midwicket
defended into the covers
moves across to a slightly shorter, quicker ball, and places the paddle-pull just wide of the fielder
a very slow cutter, pitched up and driven but straight to extra cover. Mahmudullah needs to start rotating the strike with more frequency
he presses forward in studied defence
he whips his wrists over the ball to place it in the gap between square leg and midwicket, and they scamper through
pushed easily down the ground

and he's been given out! That's a bit of a howler from the umpire there. Shakib went down to sweep a ball pitched outside off stump from around the wicket. He missed the shot and was struck on the back leg, but the ball had turned away slightly after pitching and he was hit outside the line. The ball also would have missed the stumps by a good few inches, so not a great decision there, and that'll be a major blow to Bangladesh's hopes
Naeem angles the ball behind square on the off side, but straight to the fielder
too short and down leg as well, pulled away meatily but straight to fine leg
backs away to give himself room and aims a slashing cut through the off side, but can't connect
Colly sends down a leg-stump half volley, but it's clipped straight to midwicket
tossed up and Naeem drives the ball back at him. That was hit slightly uppishly, Collingwood collected it on the bounce
the offcutter grips and turns, evading the bat and hit the pad. An optimistic appeal is turned down - that definitely would have missed leg
tucked into space on the leg side
too straight again and that's whipped out to the deep square leg fielder
tossed up again, and driven firmly down to long on
that's gripped a little, but started on leg and turned wider
leg stump line once again, but this one clips the thigh pad and goes to short fine leg
Naeem hangs back in his crease and drops the ball into the covers, and they run a sharp single
and that's another wide from Pietersen, pushed way down leg again
more leg-side nonsense from KP, and Mahmudullah punishes him for it this time, just getting a little tickle on the ball to send it very fine to the boundary
presses forward to defend. A little surprised by the turn and bounce, but no alarms
waits in the crease to place this in the gap between cover and extra
tries to work the ball away but can't time it
drift and turn from Swann, but the batsman gets across to off stump and nudges to leg
Naeem just waits on that one, running it off the face down to third man
whipped wristily to leg, and they scamper another one
tossed up high, Naeem drives back powerfully but straight at the bowler
swept powerfully out to deep square leg. Had a full go at that, but didn't quite time it
out comes the reverse sweep, and he's beaten the fielder at short third man! Finally Mahmudullah tries something different, and he's pulled off the shot handsomely
gave that one quite a rip did KP, but he also dragged it short and that should have been put away. Driven off the back foot but straight to cover
fires in a much fuller ball, dug out by the batsman. Prior hollers his approval
pushed out to the cover sweeper
attempts a nurdle to leg but can't get it away
and that's another wide from Pietersen. Pushed down leg and turning ever wider
driven straight to cover
and the batsmen pushes forward in defence
sitting on the back foot, and defended into the offside
attempts a square drive, but straight to point
super diving stop from Morgan on the square leg boundary as the batsman unfurls a powerful sweep! He's definitely saved a few runs there
pushed down the ground
tossed up with a hint of turn, and Mahmudullah can only defend
attempts to work the ball square on the leg side, but can't get it away. Stodgy innings from Mahmudullah, he really needs to get a move on
delicate late cut to short third man
tries to slash it away square, but his swishing blade meets fresh air
full and on the toes, clipped to leg
shortish and turning in but Naeem backs away to give himself room and drives into the covers off the back foot
fired down leg again, but clips the pad and Prior cuts it off, so no wide
and with 9.5 an over needed, he presses forward to defend and the ball goes nowhere
back of a length, attempted cut but it's too close and no run
defended off the back foot to short midwicket
prodded away for a single into the point region, need something bigger than this
good intent this time, couple of skips down the track and clubbed down to long on
another single, poked away gently
rolls his wrists over the ball to turn it towards square leg for one
round the wicket, angled across the batsman, who clips down the ground for one, the batsmen are going nowhere and the crowd are getting restless
another gentle single patted into space
is it Kevin Pietersen or Jim Laker? I can't tell. Whatever it is, he must be bowling grenades because the batsmen are very tentative, tickling it into leg for one
patted away for one
nothing available here, blocked resolutely
well this begged to be hit away, full toss swatted behind square for an easy four
nicely done by Swann, accurate as always, spinning and a touch of bounce
big spin from outside off, ripping into the pads and thuds away for a single

well this partnership has soaked all the momentum that Shakib's innings built and it's pretty much batted Bangladesh out of the game. Naeem finally tries to inject some life into his stodgy innings, but doesn't time his swipe down the ground and is caught on the long off boundary
flighted up and landing on an off-stump line, neatly and gently stroked back to Swann
diligent, resolute and utterly inappropriate forward defence
another dot ball, the pressure builds, the match drifts away as an attempted cover drive finds the fielder. Completes another good spell from Swann
Pietersen continues, Plunkett will feel hard done by having been given just two overs, but this is flighted outside off and slashed out to deep point
nudged away for a single, they need two a ball from here
dragged down from Pietersen, that happens to a part-time bowler every now and then, the batsman can't punish it, pulling away for a single down to square leg
on the back foot and defending into the off side
a touch shorter, Shuvo hops back and clips it into the leg side for a couple
perfectly defended, quite why I don't know
shortish, Mahmudullah tries to dab it fine and fancy past fine leg, but gets too much of it and it goes to the fielder
back of a length again, worked into the square-leg region
well a tame end to a tame innings from Mahmudullah, trying to swing this away down the ground, but hasn't timed it at all, skewing it to midwicket, who takes a sharp chance
Razzak starts how all the Bangladesh middle order didn't - giving it some welly, pulling this towards midwicket where a diving Pietersen prevents too much damage
much fuller this time, dug out into the covers for one
Bresnan slips in his bouncer, which he quite enjoys doing, but it's down the leg side
not put off by the last ball, he shoves in another short ball, that zips over the batsman to complete a tidy over
that was anything but decent, in fact, it was a hideous ball shoved well down the leg side
much more like it, full, straight, Shuvo tries to smack it away but can't and it trickles back to the bowler
well that was a knee-high full toss, asking to be clubbed far, far away, but was instead mistimed to mid on
slower ball, Razzak works it away for a single down to fine leg
back of a length, slightly slower, Shuvo gave himself some room and opted to leave it, playing himself in I suppose
good bowling from Shahzad, full, straight and dug away for one to mid on
there we go, few more of these and we'd have a game. It's actually very unlucky for Shahzad, he aimed a good bouncer, found a top-edge which flew over Prior all the way for six
Bresnan shoves in another short ball, and once again it's left alone
good stuff from Bresnan, changing his pace well, and Shuvo's swipe was only at fresh air
skewed away, off the outside edge from a flashing extra-cover swish, past third man for four
that will do nicely for Bresnan, who has bowled well today, another slower ball, catches the toe-end of another attempted off-side drive and loops pitifully to short third man
back of a length, on off stump, a play and a miss
well the only thing memorable about this is that Tim Bresnan has collected his best ODI figures, an attempted guide to third man catches the edge and is taken by Prior
a few more of these perhaps, attempted yorker is too full and too far down leg side, clips a pad and runs away for four down to fine leg
better from Shahzad, on a line, back of a length and defended well
much fuller, yorker length, Razzak tries to bunt it away but can't
this is a lovely heave, head looking to the heavens, bat whirling around at fresh air, the ball goes through to Prior
another leg-side heave attempted, doesn't time it and it runs to midwicket for one
a very stylish flick, whipping the wrists over the ball to send it out to deep square for one
almost gets it there, Razzak swing a pull shot, which comes off the inside-edge, just passed leg stump where a tumbling Prior collects
thrown a little wider, Razzak giving himself room, but his swish meets only the air and Prior collects
call Tim Bresnan a big man at your peril, but for a man of his generous build this is a fantastic stop, diving in his follow through to his left to collect a one-handed stop
shorter and shovelled away for a single into the leg side
good ball, finds some extra bounce from a tight line and it's defended back to the bowler
almost collects his five-wicket haul, with a full yorker that evades off stump by a fraction
full and swung away with no timing
tries to heave this down the ground, but doesn't time it and it trickles to mid off
Shahzad's foot saves a boundary there, full and crashed back at him, goes into his foot away for one
good ball here, full and straight and dug out, good stuff from the youngster
short, a swing, a miss, and we're one ball away
big appeal from Shahzad as the full ball hits the pads, but nobody will mind with the not-out decision. Job done for England, Bangladesh sadly end the series with a whimper.
